meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Steve Rininger Abby Fisher Lauren Girard Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6569.

td.p: Steve Rininger, a lawyer from Chicago, Illinois
Abby Fisher, a professional volunteer from Belmont, Massachusetts
Lauren Girard, a museum guest relations manager from Los Angeles, California (whose 2-day cash winnings total $51,000)

tr.td: POETIC PUNISHMENT
CENTURY OF THE INVENTION
_O_O
(Alex: For example, Pogo would be a correct response. They're all gonna be four letters.)
GEOGRAPHY: DROP A LETTER
SOMEONE'S IN THE KITCHEN
WITH DINAH

On May 2, 1863 Stonewall Jackson led his men on a 12-mile march to get into position for an attack on the unsuspecting federal troops. Lee remained behind for a frontal assault. This battle is considered Lee\'s greatest victory')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents the clue.) On May 2, 1863 Stonewall Jackson led his men on a 12-mile march to get into position for an attack on the unsuspecting federal troops. Lee remained behind for a frontal assault. This battle is considered Lee's greatest victory
